speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me how long you have been experiencing these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been having difficulty walking for about three months now, and I've needed a wheelchair for the last month. The urinary incontinence has been an issue for a year, and the slurred speech started recently.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any other symptoms, such as numbness or tingling in your limbs?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any numbness or tingling, but my limbs do feel quite rigid at times, and I have a mild tremor in my hands.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your vision, such as blurred or double vision?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any changes in my vision, like blurred or double vision. I feel like my vision is normal.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections or illnesses prior to the onset of these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses. I feel generally well aside from the symptoms I've mentioned.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your cognitive function, such as memory problems or difficulty concentrating?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant memory problems or difficulty concentrating, but I do find it a bit challenging to communicate clearly with the slurred speech.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of neurological disorders or similar symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any known family history of neurological disorders or similar symptoms. My family has generally been healthy.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your bowel habits, such as constipation or diarrhea?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant changes in my bowel habits. Everything seems to be normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of dizziness or balance issues aside from the difficulty walking?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I do feel a bit dizzy at times, especially when I stand up quickly. My balance has also been off, which makes walking even more challenging.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent falls or near-falls due to your balance issues?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any major falls, but I've had a couple of near-falls when my balance was off. It's definitely concerning, especially when I'm trying to walk.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your emotional state, such as increased anxiety or depression?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't felt particularly anxious or depressed, but I do feel frustrated with my mobility issues and the challenges in communicating. It's been tough to cope with these changes.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any muscle weakness or fatigue in your limbs?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed significant muscle weakness, but I do feel some fatigue in my limbs, especially after trying to walk. It can be quite exhausting.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of shaking or tremors in your limbs, aside from the mild tremor in your hands?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any shaking in my limbs beyond the mild tremor in my hands. It mostly happens when I'm at rest or trying to hold something.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns, such as difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any major changes in my sleep patterns. I generally fall asleep fine, but I do wake up occasionally during the night.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin, such as rashes or unusual pigmentation?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my skin, like rashes or unusual pigmentation. My skin seems to be normal.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any difficulty swallowing or changes in your ability to chew food?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any difficulty swallowing or changes in my ability to chew food. Eating feels normal for me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any stiffness or rigidity in your neck or back?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I have noticed some stiffness in my neck and back, especially when I try to turn my head. It can be uncomfortable at times.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your sense of smell or taste?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my sense of smell or taste. Everything seems to be normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent imaging studies, such as an MRI of your brain or spine?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent imaging studies done, like an MRI of my brain or spine. I haven't been referred for any yet.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: MRI_Brain_and_Spine. Let's get an MRI done to assess for any potential lesions or abnormalities in your brain and spine that could explain your symptoms.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Multiple areas of atrophy and signal changes in the brainstem, cerebellum, and basal ganglia, consistent with neurodegenerative processes.

speaker: Doctor
text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Multiple System Atrophy (MSA).
